title: Advancing Research in the Business and Management Field
abstractText:
This seminar series is organised by members of the British Academy of Management Special Interest Group in Research Methodology. The series aims to bring together a range of both experienced and junior management researchers; practitioners; and consumers of management research to discuss key questions that impact upon the future of research in the business and management field. As such it provides a unique opportunity to take an innovative approach to examining the significant issues that currently challenge those within the management research area. 

The specific questions we will be addressing are:

  • How can we enhance capacity and capability in the field of management research?
  • How can we most effectively develop management researchers?
  • How can the quality of management research be enhanced?
  • Who should management research be for, and whom should its outputs be aimed at?
  • How can management research be made more practitioner-friendly?
  • How should we be developing theories of managerial practice?
  • How can management research become more internationally focused?
  • How can management researchers diversify to use a greater variety of methodological tools and techniques?

Our objective therefore is to provide an arena in which these challenges to the future of management research can be meaningfully discussed.
